I mean, the first four months, only person I could talk to was this chick Luisa, who knew like ten words of English from watching old "Dif'rent Strokes" reruns. You just threw the whole meal into some tupper-ware and tossed it in the fridge.

[247]I'm alright.  But you can sit. 
[248]Yup. 
[249]A lot of things.  All I know is I'll be back in six months. 
[250]Not for Quincy McCall. 
[251]So, how's pro-ball, Europe? 
[252]Still working on being the first girl in the NBA? 
[253]Funny.  I never did. 
[254]Tried calling you a couple times. 
[255]Wanted to give you props on making First Team All-American.  And then when Magic retired, I tried calling you again. 
[256]Figured it was something like that. 
[257]So, when do you go back? 
[258]What do you mean? 
[259]A rest? 
[260]No. 
[261]It's okay. 
[262]I'm gonna be okay. 
[263]Kyra, this is Monica.  She, uh... 
[264]This is Kyra.  My fiance. 
[265]It means a lot that you came by. 
[266]Thanks. 
[267]Damn, girl. 
[268]I don't wanna see that. 
[269]Brother's gonna have to start locking doors. 
[270]So how long is this trip? 
[271]Nah. 
[272]You might be the only one with a job. 
[273]Sometimes I wonder if it's worth it. Busting my ass, for what? 
[274]I don't know sometimes. 
[275]A horse? 
[276]I remember when your mom had to beat you into a dress. 
[277]Kyra's gone for a couple days.  Figured I'd keep Mom company. 
[278]Darryl.  He's alright, kinda corny. 
[279]Getting there. 
[280]Yeah.  Two weeks. I didn't get to send you an invitation, but if you... 
[281]Can I ask you something? 
[282]You never told me why ball isn't fun anymore. 
[283]Because I'm kinda feeling that way, too. 
[284]That a nice way of saying I rode the bench? 
[285]Nah.  I haven't dribbled a ball in four and a half months.  Maybe I miss some of the attention, but besides that... 
[286]Seems like I needed a ball when I was trying to be like my pops...or trying to be better than him.  Now, I kinda think I need to try something else. 
[287]Maybe go back to school. 
[288]I mean, Kyra hasn't heard the school thing yet. She'll probably say it's the painkillers talking. 
[289]So why'd you give up ball? 
[290]Cause I don't get it. 
[291]What? 
[292]Find. 
[293]What's going on? 
[294]Hold on. 
[295]What? 
[296]you woke me up to tell me that? 
[297]I heard enough. 
[298]We haven't talked since college and now you wait two weeks before my wedding to say something like this? 
[299]You haven't changed.  You still think the sun rises and sets on your ass.  Well, guess what, it doesn't. 
[300]Because you don't pull this on someone who's about to get married. 
[301]Wrong. 
[302]What? 
[303]For what? 
[304]You're out of your mind. 
[305]What's that supposed to be, psychology? 
[306]Monica, after that stuff with my dad, I couldn't trust anybody, okay.  I mean, I was lost.  So you are forgiven.  But that was five years ago.  I moved on. 
[307]What will this prove? 
[308]So? 
[309]And what happens when you lose? 
[310]One, five.  Check. 
[311]All's fair in love and basketball, right? 
[312]Hey. 
[313]Double or nothing. 
[314]Let's go, McCall! 
[315]Go Mommy.
dialogues.CAMILLE:
[1]She needs to stop running around like a little boy. 
[2]How is she alright looking the way she does? 
[3]I'll get some ice. 
[4]Until the Black family down the street became the Black family next door. 
[5]Well, thanks again.  This was really nice of you. 
[6]Oh, me too.  I used to cook for my friends' parties and things back in Atlanta. 
[7]Well, no, but once Nathan gets settled and the girls get a little older, it's definitely something I want to do. Since you love to cook, maybe it's something we can talk about. 
[8]Really?  Well, come on, then. 
[9]Honey, put this in the kitchen. 
[10]Monica, what did you do? 
[11]Oh, all that work. 
[12]I'm lucky I found it.  Someone put your box of dresses under a pile of rags in the garbage. 
[13]Child, pick up your lip. 
[14]Fine, you don't like this one, which one would you rather wear? 
[15]When you're done can you make sure she brushes her teeth? 
[16]I just need to lay down.  I've been running around all day. 
[17]The blue. 
[18]Okay. 
[19]The boy next door is riding with you to school so you'll know somebody your first day. Hurry so she can go to sleep. 
[20]...and if you want a thicker base, you can cut in a potato or just use a little flour. 
[21]So that means it's alright for you to act like that? 
[22]I don't know why I keep hoping you'll grow out of this tomboy thing. 
[23]That's not funny 
[24]Watch your mouth. 
[25]If you'd just listen for once, you'd realize you have a lot more going for yourself.  You're smart, you'd be pretty if you put a comb to your head.  I mean, why walk around with your hair looking like "whodunit"...? 
[26]Monica, please. 
[27]Taste this. 
[28]Child, take a bite. 
[29]I found some apricot chutney and mixed it with the yams. 
[30]Sure.  In between all the other things I have to do. 
[31]Nothing.  So good luck. 
[32]Go in my top drawer and get my pearls. 
[33]You okay? 
[34]Well, can you promise me one thing? 
[35]Tonight, don't worry about yesterday's game, the recruiters, or anything else. I just want you to enjoy being beautiful. Will you do that? 
[36]Monica.  What are you doing here? 
[37]Don't be defensive.  I'm just surprised to see you. 
[38]He's still at the bank. 
[39]Everything okay? 
[40]Well, I'm going to get dinner. 
[41]It's just a game. 
[42]Whenever you lose, you get this attitude. But it's just a game. 
[43]Hi. 
[44]I can manage. 
[45]Your sister's bringing the baby over. You should try to be here. 
[46]How is he? 
[47]To that stewardess? 
[48]His mother had a cookout a few weeks ago. He could do a lot better if you ask me. 
[49]I thought you were over him. 
[50]Find out where they're registered and send them a gift. 
[51]You didn't want my opinion in the first place, so why even ask? 
[52]Don't curse. 
[53]What do you want me to tell you, Monica, to go beat that girl up?  To go have sex with him?  I'm not going to do that. Yes, I believe thinking of other people is important and yes I'd rather bake a pie than shoot a dumb jump shot.  If that makes me too "prissy" for you, too bad. 
[54]You're the one always turning your nose up at me. 
[55]Child, please.  Ever since you were little you thought you were too good for anything I had to say. 
[56]What was so wrong with wanting to teach you the things I knew could help you? 
[57]So you're angry with me because you're standing here with your hair combed and wearing perfume? 
[58]Oh, yes.  The superstar female athlete whose mother is nothing but a housewife. 
[59]Don't tell me you aren't ashamed of that because I know. 
[60]I don't remember that. 
[61]That's ridiculous. 
[62]Dammitt, Monica! 
[63]Is that really all you think of me? 
[64]When I married your father, all I wanted was a nice house with a big kitchen so I could start my catering business.  And then I got pregnant with Lena, and then I got pregnant with you.  And I put it out of my mind because that's what you did. 
[65]But you want to know what day I remember? In high school, you getting ready for the Spring Dance.  I put my pearls around your neck, told you you were beautiful and you looked like you were going to cry.  That day I was happy I didn't have a catering business to run off to.  My family had three meals a day, had someone to pick up after them, and when my daughters went to a dance, I helped them get ready.  That's what I came to care about. 
[66]You had your coaches and your father for that stuff.  It never mattered one way or the other if I went to your games. 
[67]So you're still breast-feeding? 
[68]You might want to put a jacket on him, it's getting cold. 
[69]Okay. 
[70]God.  "Grandma." 
[71]You know, I'd probably be a lot more "prissy" in the situation than you'd like, but the thing I always admired that drove me crazy, was the fight you had in you. 
[72]When I said Quincy could do better, I was thinking about you.
dialogues.ZEKE:
[1]Girl, who you trying to fool? 
[2]See, Quincy, this is how your Moms caught me, with the old fake and bake.  Had me thinking I was getting a sister who could burn. 
[3]Boy, what'd I tell you about using that word? 
[4]Why not? 
[5]That's right. 
[6]What? Oh, and, uh, don't say "shit." 
[7]Just you and Quincy, baby.  I got a meeting. 
[8]Business folks. 
[9]Nona, don't start bitching.  I got maybe two years left to play.  I'm just trying to put some things together for us. 
[10]Later, Quincy. 
[11]Don't go starting rumors, Jim.  My son's college bound with or without basketball. 
[12]Gotta wait til the press conference. 
[13]I'd love for him to get a good education. That's it. 
[14]We should have another talk with Coach Carril at Princeton. 
[15]I don't care about the team.  I care about the school. 
[16]You played good.  I was proud of you. 
[17]I don't wanna hurt your feelings. 
[18]Anyway, I gotta get to this meeting. Tell your Mom I'm gonna be late. 
[19]Let's hope I can say the same about you one day. 
[20]Hey, Miss Baller. 
[21]I had some players to see and hands to shake. 
[22]I'm not gonna get anywhere punching a clock just so my wife doesn't get an attitude. 
[23]Yeah. 
[24]I have. 
[25]No, you said I should get my degree.  I like my "bullshit" job, okay, and it's gonna lead to a spot in the front office. Til then, don't worry, there's just enough savings to keep your ass in Gucci and gold. 
[26]Keep your voice down. 
[27]Genuine Draft.  And an orange juice for my kid. 
[28]Didn't need a cross-over to post you up. 
[29]What people? 
[30]Well, tell them to mind their damn business.  You're smart enough to get a degree. 
[31]You know how much higher the play level is in the NBA?  Give yourself time to develop, Quincy.  Get an education.  The NBA ain't going nowhere. 
[32]Your mom got pregnant and I had to make choices.  You don't have a choice. 
[33]Besides, the sooner you go pro, the sooner you'll have to deal with the mess I'm dealing with. 
[34]there's this thing out there.  This paternity suit. 
[35]Some girl that's been hanging on at every party.  now I'm supposed to be her baby's Daddy. Anyway, I told your mom I wanted to be the one who told you. 
[36]I just told you. 
[37]You got the balls to ask me that? 
[38]No, you need to hear me say it, I'll say it.  It's not true. 
[39]I want this thing to go to court, but my lawyer's telling me to settle. 
[40]A case like this could hang around for months and I'm up for this player relations job with the "Clips."  This gets out, false or not, no one'll touch me. 
[41]We haven't exactly been living the fairy- tale life the past few years.  Something like this happens, it either brings a family closer or pushes them further apart.  We'll just have to see how it plays out. I'm giving her some space, couple days... 
[42]Your door was unlocked. 
[43]We need to talk. 
[44]I messed up, okay, I know that.  But I ain't that kid's father. 
[45]Look, I ain't saying it was right, but sometimes things happen. 
[46]Boy, you're so perfect you can look down on me? 
[47]Your mom was real quick to show you those pictures, wasn't she? Well, she was nineteen when she got pregnant and don't get me wrong, you're the best thing in my life, but she knew I wasn't ready for no marriage. 
[48]I'm saying I handled my responsibilities like a man.  But when you're in the NBA, you pull into a city and there's a hundred women waiting at the hotel.  And another twenty that made it past security on your floor.  And the boldest one is standing right at your door.  And after awhile, it just becomes part of the game. I'm sorry I lied to you, I shouldn't have.  But I did it cause I love you. 
[49]What? 
[50]Quincy, you'd be making the biggest mistake of your life. 
[51]I know your mad at me, okay, but I can't let you do this. 
[52]Nona. 
[53]How's he doing? 
[54]What's that, not great? 
[55]Nona, please. 
[56]Almost didn't recognize you with your hair like that.  How you been? 
[57]Hey, son. 
[58]Well, you made SportsCenter. 
[59]Came by to check on you. 
[60]Don't remember that being my fault. Seems like you divorced me same time as your mom. 
[61]I can see that.  I know things look pretty bleak right now, but you can't get down on yourself. 
[62]No. 
[63]Quincy.  I know you left school early to throw your middle finger up at me. 
[64]You want me to fuck off? 
[65]Fine, I'll fuck off, but not til I say something. 
[66]You're a better ballplayer than I ever was.  But you got a lot of other things going for you.  You're smart.  I always felt...I always knew that you could do anything you wanted.  You want to be a ballplayer, be a ballplayer.  Just know you ain't like everybody else on that court.  You ain't like I was.  You got options.  That's all I ever tried to show you. 
[67]I just couldn't
dialogues.NONA:
[1]Boy... 
[2]New neighbors. 
[3]Zeke. 
[4]We should head over. 
[5]With who? 
[6]You just got back from a four game road trip. 
[7]What? 
[8]Yeah. 
[9]...we moved back here when Quincy was about five, after Zeke was traded. Neighborhood was a little more mixed back then... 
[10]Okay? 
[11]It was the least we could do.  And I love to cook. 
[12]You're a caterer? 
[13]You know, girl, long as I've lived next door, I've never seen the inside of this house. 
[14]Help her, Quincy. 
[15]It's...it's okay.  Can I get a towel? 
[16]No.  Good boy. 
[17]What is this? 
[18]I look like some hoochie to you?  I found it on your floor. 
[19]Quincy, I told you about these fat-ass girls. 
[20]I'm not playing with you, these girls are looking to get you caught.  They see you, they see dollar signs. 
[21]You hearing me? 
[22]How was your game? 
[23]Still the man. 
[24]Where's your dad? 
[25]Later when? 
[26]At one in the morning? 
[27]I came second to the NBA.  I'm not about to come second to this bullshit scouting job. 
[28]I didn't mean it like that. 
[29]I'm just saying it'd be nice if you found time for your family. You should see the tramps coming after Quincy.  If you don't talk to him... 
[30]You said you'd think about going back to get your degree. 
[31]Fine, then how many nights home is that? 
[32]How about now?  I got a week yet? 
[33]You scared me. 
[34]I'm fine. 
[35]Guess he talked to you. 
[36]Whose truth are you talking about? 
[37]Just...leave it alone. 
[38]Quincy, please... 
[39]Guess I should have been telling your father. 
[40]I hired somebody.  How pathetic is that? After all his late nights and "meetings" and I still needed proof. 
[41]I used to think I was lucky just to be married to Zeke McCall, but I'm too tired. 
[42]Not great. 
[43]The doctor'll be back in a minute. 
[44]He tore his ACL. 
[45]Happy.  And he won't want to see you.
dialogues.SIDRA:
[1]That's right, Coach. 
[2]Dag, you took her out, T. 
[3]You got it, c'mon, lift! 
[4]That's it. 
[5]She hates all freshmen. 
[6]Hey, don't take it personal.  And don't think just cause we play the same position we have to compete with each other.  We're teammates, okay? 
[7]Besides.  I've been starting point the last two years.  Ain't no way some dumb- ass freshman is taking my spot. 
[8]That's what you get for trying to show out, freshman. 
[9]You were trying to make me look bad. 
[10]Girl, don't you know you're just sloppy seconds? 
[11]Only reason you're here is cause Tonya Randall got pregnant and decided not to come.  They were done recruiting. 
[12]Just thought the girl should know. 
[13]Least you got an offer.  My agent's still looking. 
[14]Monica. 
[15]Just wanted to say good game. 
[16]No buts.  Took a lot of heart to take that charge. 
[17]But that was a dumb-ass pass to Toni. Ten seconds left, you run out the clock. 
[18]I'd be lying if I said I wasn't pissed. 
[19]Just one word of advice for next season. 
[20]Never let a freshman take your spot. 
[21]Well, what do you know. 
[22]I'm gonna love winning this championship in your house. 
[23]Can you take that damn thing off the table. 
[24]Still a cocky bitch. 
[25]Yeah, four years ago.  They had me staying in this tiny-ass town with like fifty people.  I'm not playing, there was about a thousand goats running around, and it gets dark at four o'clock.  Then the whack club I'm on loses three games in a row and I get blamed.  So they fire me. 
[26]Yup.  So I've been playing with this Italian club the last three years. 
[27]It's better.  Even though the whole first season my teammates didn't pass to me cause they were mad "The American" was making more money. I led the team in rebounds cause it was the only way I could touch the damn ball. 
[28]Most of us don't win championships our first year overseas. 
[29]So what are these Spanish guys like? 
[30]What?  You've been over here seven months and you ain't tapped anything? 
[31]Shoot, Italian boys love them some black women.  They can't get enough of me. 
[32]Sometimes.  But what's the alternative, not playing?  You remember big Toni? She quit last year, now she's working at some bookstore.  I mean, look at us. They treat us like we're Hollywood stars over here.  We just played in the championship game.  It doesn't get much sweeter than this.
dialogues.LENA:
[1]Ow! 
[2]Are you okay? 
[3]But you use potato? 
[4]What'd you do? 
[5]That too tight? 
[6]Mom's going to hate it. 
[7]Like you don't give her a hard time. 
[8]You need to.  She's alone in this house all day, taking care of Dad and your ungrateful behind. 
[9]Just try and chill a little bit, alright. 
[10]So what's going on with the Spring Dance? You have a date yet? 
[11]I found you someone. 
[12]I know... 
[13]No. 
[14]This brother from my college. 
[15]And he's fine, girl. 
[16]I told him you looked like me. 
[17]You do. 
[18]If you were tore up I would not be claiming you.  Trust. 
[19]We'll do something cute with your hair, get you a dress, get you some heels... 
[20]Hey.  You just worry about playing your behind off for that recruiter tonight. Let me worry about your date. 
[21]Too many times. 
[22]Yeah, once I cut them off.  Why? 
[23]Might help if you didn't look so evil. 
[24]Mom!  
[25]Talk to me. 
[26]Here. 
[27]The doctor said it was okay.  Anyway, I'm still trying to lose some of this baby fat. 
[28]Shut up. 
[29]He's fine. 
[30]Come on, L.P.  Grandma says it's too cold.
dialogues.COACH MILLER:
[1]I don't know some of you very well yet, and you don't know me because I'm still being nice to you. 
[2]But my philosophy is simple. Hard work and sacrifice. There's a lot of basketball history and pride here at USC, but just putting on the cardinal and gold doesn't make you a great player.  Hard work and sacrifice makes you a great player.  What you were doesn't matter anymore.  For the first time in your life, you won't be the best. You'll be going up against women that are bigger and stronger and better than you ever imagined.  So the question is, how will you respond?  Well, your answer better be hard work and sacrifice because that's the only way you're gonna make it through.  Vince Lombardi preached it and I teach it, "There is only one way to succeed at anything and that is to give everything." 
[3]A few simple rules.  Eleven o'clock curfew, no exceptions.  Always be on time, no exceptions.  Attend every class, no exceptions.  No drugs, no alcohol, no getting pregnant.  And finally, respect yourselves, respect your coaches and respect your teammates, right Sidra? 
[4]By the end of this year some of you will hate me... 
[5]Some of you will want to go home... 
[6]But I guarantee you, if you work hard and sacrifice, all of you will be better basketball players and better people. 
[7]Let's go, freshmen, you're getting spanked! 
[8]Monica, I'm putting you on my Wizard of Oz team.  No brains, no courage and no heart! 
[9]Way to work, Zvette. 
[10]Get lower, Monica, move your feet. 
[11]I said lower! 
[12]This is low, got it?  Offense sells tickets, defense wins games! 
[13]Monica, you trying to tell me you can't take a little challenge? 
[14]This time get your feet set. 
[15]Next! 
[16]Sidra!  You feel like playing any "D"? 
[17]Monica!  Get over here. 
[18]While you're so busy posing, your man just scored! 
[19]Show me again. 
[20]You love to pose so much, let's see it again. 
[21]I want you to stand like that for the rest of practice. 
[22]I want you to stand like that until you're sick of it because I don't ever want to see it again, you hear me? Dora, take her spot. 
[23]That's it, that's it! 
[24]Monica. 
[25]You could've given up after you threw that ball away.  But you kept your head and you showed real heart. 
[26]We've got our final games against Oregon and Oregon State and I want to shake things up a bit, so I'm starting you at point again. 
[27]You want the job or not? 
[28]What? 
[29]You think I'd go hoarse for a player with no potential?   When I ignore you, that's when you worry. Go get dressed. 
[30]Sidra.
dialogues.JASON:
[1]Can I take your coat? 
[2]No, I mean I can check it for you. 
[3]Your sister wasn't lying. 
[4]What's up, Black.  I'm Jason. 
[5]So, you like school? 
[6]Yeah, high school was cool.  I don't remember sisters being as fine as you, though. 
[7]So what do you like studying? 
[8]I'm an English major.  You like English? 
[9]Careful. 
[10]That was two words. 
[11]Girl, how come you're so stressed? 
[12]I mean, I'm having a good time with you... 
[13]So tell me what I have to do to make you have a good time with me. 
[14]Then I'll get you some punch. 
[15]Just don't jet while I'm gone and leave a glass slipper behind. 
[16]There we go. 
[17]You want to dance? 
[18]That was nice. 
[19]Your sister told me hands off, but I can't help myself... 
[20]Shh.  It's okay.
dialogues.NATHAN:
[1]How are you feeling, munchkin? 
[2]Yeah, you're through. 
[3]She's alright. 
[4]Camille, she'll be fine. 
[5]Which one for tomorrow? 
[6]You sure? 
[7]Can you iron both tonight just in case? 
[8]Thanks, sweetheart. 
[9]And what am I supposed to say to the man? 
[10]You lost your head. 
[11]Monica, I think her point is...maybe it's time to start thinking about other things besides basketball. 
[12]You only have one game left and you haven't been recruited.  Munchkin, I wanted it as bad as you did, but we have to face reality. 
[13]I know.  But chances are... 
[14]Hey, munchkin. 
[15]I was upstairs for a meeting.  I've been hearing good things about you. 
[16]So how's the job going? 
[17]I think I know what the problem is. 
[18]There. 
[19]I'll take that as a compliment.
dialogues.KYRA:
[1]I'm so sorry.  No one would switch flights with me. 
[2]Why are you up?  Get in bed. 
[3]Tell me you're going to be okay. 
[4]Hello. 
[5]Monica.  You grew up together, right? Quincy's told me about you. 
[6]Thank you. 
[7]Yes, we appreciate that. 
[8]What? 
[9]Get used to it, babe. 
[10]Four days. 
[11]So are you going to be the kind of husband who won't let his wife work? 
[12]Why not? 
[13]Baby, don't talk like that.  Your rehab's going well.  You'll be back before you know it. 
[14]To do what you love. 
[15]You're just scared.  I know rehab is hard, and you have to worry about whether you'll be as good as you were but you will be.  I believe in you.  You just have to get back on the court.  Like you'd get back on a horse. 
[16]Don't make fun of me when I'm being wonderful and supportive. You belong on the court.  Just like I belong in the stands, looking cute and cheering you on.
dialogues.SHAWNEE:
[1]Hey, girl. 
[2]Your hair looks so cute like that. 
[3]So...you know who Q's asking to the Spring Dance? 
[4]C'mon, girl, you live next door.  Who's been creeping? 
[5]Well, can you give him this for me? 
[6]I don't wanna look fast. Thanks, girl. 
[7]Good Lord, look at that ass.  I just want to lick the sweat off it. 
[8]Q, I like this song... 
[9]Dang, girl, I didn't know Nike made dresses.
dialogues.ANGLE ON:
[1]Quincy, who glances over from the middle of the dance floor, and abruptly stops.  He stares at Monica in shock. 
[2]Monica, sees Quincy approaching in his suit.  She quickly steadies herself on her heels, brushes a curl from her face. 
[3]Monica, nervous at first, a little awkward, but Jason gently guides her in a slow circle and she starts to relax. Jason moves his hands down Monica's back, pulling her in closer.  Shawnee snuggles into Quincy's chest, runs her hands down his neck.  The heat from bodies grows. Monica and Quincy glance up at the same time and catch each other's eyes.  They start to look away but find they can't. Eyes locked as they dance, they move together, almost feel each other.  Finally, as their bodies turn, they lose sight. Monica puts her head to Jason's chest, Quincy slides his hands lower down Shawnee's back.  The music continues... 
[4]Monica looks over at Quincy and sees him talking to the hoochie.  The girl looks too damn comfortable.  Monica moves back outside. 
[5]Laker announcers CHICK HEARN and STU LANTZ. 
[6]Quincy pulls off his sweats and jogs onto the court with the rest of the subs.  He is twenty-three, a man.  His goatee and tired eyes make him look older.  HE NOW WEARS NUMBER TWENTY- 
[7]Chick and Stu. 
[8]Quincy steals the ball, has nothing but open court ahead of him. 
[9]Camille watches from the kitchen window
dialogues.SHAYLA:
[1]Don't even trip.  She's just mad cause she's bow-legged. 
[2]Go to sleep. 
[3]Mon, Sidra's out for one game, and you got the start.  But you get caught breaking curfew and Coach is gonna send your ass back to the bench.  You'll see your man tomorrow. 
[4]Yo sis, what's going on?
